intro: Cacalia pedunculata, commonly known as the slender cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. Cacalia pedunculata is often found in the understory of forests and thrives in partial shade.
